intro: Amerosedum, commonly known as the rock saltbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs adapted to arid and saline environments. These plants are characterized by their small, often succulent leaves and clustered flowers that can range in color from white to pink. Amerosedum is native to regions of North America, particularly the western United States and northern Mexico. Its ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions makes it an important component of desert ecosystems.
